territory.notes: Though sighted by the Portuguese as early as the sixteenth century, the Ellice Islands were named for the owner of the ship whose captain visited the Funafuti Atoll in 1819. From 1892 to 1916, the Ellice Islands were part of the Gilbert Islands Protectorate; from 1916 to 1975, Tuvalu was the ‘Ellice’ in the Gilbert and Ellice Islands, a crown colony.
